law.catch_line: Natural History Museum -- Board of directors -- Appointments, terms, and meetings.

text.section: The director of the Kentucky Natural History Museum shall serve as an ex officio member of the board of directors, be counted for purposes of establishing a quorum for conducting business, and be entitled to participate in deliberations of the board, but shall not be entitled to vote when official actions are taken by the board.

The first chair of the Kentucky Natural History Museum Board of Directors shall be the executive director of the Kentucky Historical Society, who shall call the first meeting of the board. At the first meeting, the board shall elect a chair. Each chair elected by the board shall serve a single term of three (3) years.
The Kentucky Academy of Science's appointees shall serve three (3) year terms, and they may be reappointed for a second term.
Nominees for appointment to the board shall have resided in Kentucky for at least one (1) year immediately prior to their consideration for appointment.
The board may request the Governor to replace an appointed member who fails to attend three (3) consecutive board meetings.
The appointed members of the board shall serve without pay but shall be paid for expenses directly related to attending board meetings and to performing board authorized activities.
The board shall meet at least four (4) times a year.

law.history: Amended 2015 Ky. Acts ch. 69, sec. 3, effective June 24, 2015. -- Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 329, sec. 2, effective July 14, 2000.
